alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of showers with strong winds will impact portions of northeastern Hunterdon, Morris, Sussex, Warren and northeastern Northampton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers extending from near Montague to Newton to Forks. Movement was east at 40 mph. These showers have a history of producing wind gusts of 48 mph across the Pocono Plateau. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Morristown, Newton, Montague, Dover, Hopatcong, Forks, Kinnelon, Hackettstown, Boonton, Wilson, Butler, Wharton, Washington, Rockaway, Blairstown, Nazareth, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington and Franklin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 1, and between mile markers 4 and 6. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 4 and 43. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 42 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
